data.text: IMF Financial Counsellor Tobias Adrian outlines four main issues for policy makers. Read the latest Global Financial Stability Report #GFSR ➡️https://t.co/asjC1NeNuO https://t.co/R18XJ3B1ak
What impact will the war in Ukraine have on the global economy? Read our latest #IMFBlog to find out. https://t.co/SFp7kFYUwO #WEO

Chief Economist @pogourinchas: Countries have grown faster and improved living standards because of globalization. More fragmentation would undo many of the gains and potentially lead to efficiency losses and reduced living standards. https://t.co/ByXwki9c84 #WEO https://t.co/xsFCqRfR6T

Today's key takeaway from #IMFMeetings: the IMF downgraded its global growth outlook, reflecting the impact of the war in Ukraine, the risks posed by inflation, and more. Read our recap of the day here: https://t.co/LOdvQC0tQF https://t.co/nINSGWssxa

What do @KGeorgieva, @miaamormottley, @Lagarde, Jerome Powell, and Sri Mulyani Indrawati think about the global economy and challenges confronting the recovery? Join us on April 21 at 1:00 PM ET for our #GlobalEcon debate, moderated by @SaraEisen. https://t.co/VEhOZXYuXZ https://t.co/Wq502d5jWz

A record rise in private debt could slow economic recovery by 0.9% of GDP in advanced economies and 1.3% in emerging markets over the next 3 years, according to a new #IMFBlog. https://t.co/j96eP0x44n https://t.co/hRb7rb2F8X

We project economic downgrades for all regions. Ending the war in Ukraine, ensuring equitable access to COVID-19 tools, acting on climate change, reigning in inflation, and supporting vulnerable populations can improve the economic outlook. https://t.co/J6EVpjOcP3 #WEO https://t.co/w8nd5OuBav

Interested in supply chain disruptions and inflation? Check out these 3 Analytical Corner talks about soaring shipping costs, port congestion, and supply bottlenecks:  https://t.co/XG9Fj5FtDD // #IMFMeetings https://t.co/wc1jsWHdo0

JOIN US TOMORROW APR 20, 7 AM ET for a press briefing w/ the IMF’s Vitor Gaspar, @PaoloMauroEcon, and Paulo Medas for the launch of the April 2022 #FiscalMonitor 
https://t.co/Ww7C7hU1pp https://t.co/xjXTmbgfJi

Emerging and frontier markets face higher risk of capital outflows because of the war in Ukraine, according to our latest Global Financial Stability Report. #IMFBlog has more on the threats and longer-term effects on economies and markets. https://t.co/Os0NvhTGaW #GFSR https://t.co/movVYCJY00

Global financial stability risks are rising as the war in Ukraine complicates the push to contain inflation. Central banks may need to raise rates faster than expected, which would have a global impact. See our latest #IMFBlog for more: https://t.co/Os0Nvibhzw #GFSR https://t.co/PUz92PcQBX

The sharp rise in commodity prices has exacerbated preexisting inflation pressure. Central banks should act decisively to prevent inflation from becoming entrenched without putting the recovery at risk. #GFSR: https://t.co/asjC1NeNuO https://t.co/wUZKh3pLfr

Policymakers need to remain vigilant. Although no global systemic event affecting financial institutions or markets has materialized so far, financial stability risks have risen, as have risks to the post-pandemic economic recovery. #GFSR https://t.co/asjC1NeNuO https://t.co/eSi3HIu4sB

The war in Ukraine has caused spikes in volatility across asset classes, reflecting greater uncertainty about the global economic outlook. Read the latest Global Financial Stability Report: https://t.co/asjC1NeNuO #GFSR https://t.co/msO2Ll6wPj

The war in Ukraine is costing lives and hitting the global economy. In this new World Economic Outlook video, find out how much this will affect global growth and what policymakers can do. https://t.co/J6EVpjwBqt #WEO https://t.co/mbuFZgzU9e

Most emerging and developing countries are grappling with the economic fallout of the war and the long-term damage to their economies from the pandemic.The divergence that opened up in 2021 with advanced economies is expected to persist. https://t.co/SFp7kFYUwO #WEO https://t.co/mTxgGkTANn
What impact will the war in Ukraine have on the global economy? Read our latest #IMFBlog to find out. https://t.co/SFp7kFYUwO #WEO https://t.co/Rx0eHPn2tJ

The trade and financial sanctions imposed on Russia following the invasion of Ukraine will have a severe impact on the Russian economy. As a result, we project the economy to contract by -8.5% in 2022. https://t.co/J6EVpjwBqt #WEO https://t.co/LNL10Gv1Ej

The war will cause a severe contraction of Ukraine’s economy by about 35% in 2022. Even if the war ends soon, the loss of life, destruction, and flight of citizens will impede economic activity for many years to come. https://t.co/J6EVpjwBqt #WEO https://t.co/iMMpHGbEn4

IMF Growth Projections: 2022

USA🇺🇸: 3.7%
Germany🇩🇪: 2.1%
France🇫🇷: 2.9%
Italy🇮🇹: 2.3%
Spain🇪🇸: 4.8%
Japan🇯🇵: 3.3% 
UK🇬🇧: 3.7%
Canada🇨🇦: 3.9%
China🇨🇳: 4.4%
India🇮🇳: 8.2%
Russia🇷🇺: -8.5%
Brazil🇧🇷: 0.8%
Mexico🇲🇽: 2.0%
KSA🇸🇦: 7.6%
Nigeria🇳🇬: 3.4%
RSA🇿🇦: 1.9%

https://t.co/J6EVpjwBqt https://t.co/NqVHNWhUwv

📣 The IMF projects the global economy to slow to 3.6% in 2022 and 2023, largely reflecting the direct impact of the war in Ukraine and its global impact. More in the latest World Economic Outlook. https://t.co/J6EVpjOcP3 #WEO https://t.co/xmUcumGfmW
#IMFMeetings day 1 recap: central banks & digital money, investing in girls, #WEO, #GFSR, and more. Watch and read up on what you missed here: https://t.co/UXJIAhbhtc https://t.co/feivXRvqzp

The surge in global private debt in 2020 to 13% of GDP was widespread, faster than during the global financial crisis and almost as large as the rise in public debt. Our latest #WEO looks at the implications for global recovery. https://t.co/eZzuNkRXeB

This year’s @BIS_org-@BankOfEngland-@ECB-IMF Spillover Conference (April 27-28) will focus on the international transmission of vulnerabilities, shocks and policies, and the trade-offs for policymakers. Register to participate here: https://t.co/Cexjx236dH https://t.co/FuSOpV8dIy

#IMFMeetings quote of the day: “If you educate all girls and give them access to quality education, you add up to $30 trillion dollars to the world economy.”
Find out what happened today at the Spring Meetings: https://t.co/UXJIAhbhtc https://t.co/cyt4oZmt5D

Visit the 2022 IMF Spring Meetings’ Virtual NewsStand to check out the Meetings’ media partners and get their latest coverage on the global economy and international development. https://t.co/59cXjQT03q https://t.co/RFbgjErZfA

The war in Ukraine means Europe faces a new set of challenges. Learn how the war impacts the economic recovery in the region. Tune in to the European Regional Economic Outlook - April 22nd 9:00AM ET.  
https://t.co/Piiyr0KDfu

What are the implications of the war in Ukraine on the global financial system? We will issue the latest Global Financial Stability Report #GFSR on April 19 at 10:30 AM. 

⏳ Stay tuned! 

https://t.co/PqY8N0qCSy

Starting now: @IMFAsia Anne-Marie Gulde-Wolf discusses tackling inflation during uncertain times with @ReserveBankofNZ Governor, Adrian Orr, at the #IMFMeetings. 
Tune in now: https://t.co/ScbeUTNtdj https://t.co/XBbI9d6AI9

Starting now: the IMF’s Sahra Sakha discusses new research about digitalization and resilience in the Middle East and Central Asia during COVID-19. Tune in at  https://t.co/xxNkh2G1yO // #IMFMeetings https://t.co/0tSQRgzjUe

5 key questions & answers about the new Resilience and Sustainability Trust. 
 
Read them here: https://t.co/Q6TjtAJ4WQ https://t.co/e2lGhHVSFL

Governments lessened the economic pain of the pandemic by providing a financial lifeline to stricken businesses and consumers, but these policies led to a spike in private debt that could slow down the recovery. Read the #IMFBlog. https://t.co/j96eP0ftcP https://t.co/GbXbtXTSnq

The surge in global private debt in 2020 to 13% of GDP was widespread, faster than during the global financial crisis and almost as large as the rise in public debt. Our latest #WEO looks at the implications for global recovery. https://t.co/eZzuNl9y69 https://t.co/WPLY3X4UsY

The average ratio of public debt to GDP—a key measure of a country’s fiscal health—is a record 67% in emerging economies. Our new #IMFBlog has more on the risks and how to reduce them. #GFSR https://t.co/frv1ECIAtv https://t.co/xNdiKOrqCi

Emerging-market governments rely on banks for credit, and banks rely on government bonds as collateral for securing funding from the central bank. The result is the sovereign-bank nexus, and it’s posing new risks. See #IMFBlog for more: https://t.co/frv1ECZDvv #GFSR https://t.co/ZtPmwgYIyj

The pandemic left emerging-market banks holding record amounts of government debt, raising the odds that pressure on public finances may threaten financial stability. See our new #IMFBlog for how to reduce those risks. #GFSR https://t.co/frv1ECZDvv https://t.co/DKygZDVKTA

The transmission of risks between the sovereign and banking sectors is significant in emerging markets. The spillover effects of sovereign risk on bank and corporate credit risks are at least twice as large as the impacts in the reverse direction. #GFSR 👉 https://t.co/dIKpk1OZin https://t.co/lVaCf9IVDT

The latest #GSFR examines the mutual dependence of banks and governments in emerging markets, focusing especially on the COVID-19 pandemic, and puts forward policy options to minimize potential risks and enhance resilience. 
👉 https://t.co/dIKpk1OZin https://t.co/nYKLi4tpSo

Banks’ holdings of domestic sovereign debt have increased to record highs in emerging markets during the COVID-19 pandemic, accounting for about one-fifth (1/5) of banking sector assets in some economies. #GFSR https://t.co/dIKpk1OZin https://t.co/yZzeuZyQeC

What does the war in Ukraine, continuing pandemic and surging inflation mean for the global economy?

Join Chief Economist @pogourinchas, Petya Koeva Brooks, and Malhar Nabar for our latest analysis and projections.

🗓April 19
🕘 9:00 AM ET
📺 https://t.co/J6EVpjOcP3
#️⃣ #WEO https://t.co/snJ78TPfFU

The pandemic isn’t over, and the health and economic losses continue to rise. Join us for our 2022 IMF-World Bank Group Spring Meetings, as we discuss how we can still emerge stronger, safer, and smarter—together.

Follow the events via #IMFmeetings ➡️ https://t.co/ZMW6sAr8RD https://t.co/7R5BPyXYWf

Higher commodity and import prices around the world were key drivers of #inflation in 2021. 

Our analysis suggests that these play a larger role in Latin America than they do in advanced economies. https://t.co/eGmBZznJpM #IMFAmericas https://t.co/8ZxcfHvOKq

The IMF has approved a new trust aimed at helping countries address macro-critical challenges such as climate change. As @KGeorgieva explained at her Spring #IMFmeetings speech, the new instrument will provide affordable longer-term funding and catalyze private investment. https://t.co/PuJ1Pn5Oft

The Panama Papers revealed massive hidden wealth. With the rise of digital assets that allow for even greater anonymity, information sharing among countries is increasingly vital. Learn more #IMFblog 
https://t.co/KpwEBsSe4Q https://t.co/cIFaY9ql0M

Sign up for our special #IMFmeetings daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the schedule, report launches and other highlights from the 2022 Spring Meetings.

https://t.co/wwmpOoHMGp https://t.co/vuA96yfggZ

As the world grapples with inflation, the pandemic, war, and climate change, the World Bank – IMF 2022 Spring Meetings are the perfect platform to discuss these issues, and more. 

Check out our lineup and follow via #IMFmeetings ➡️ https://t.co/ZMW6sAr8RD https://t.co/4fvpbDfMP7

Supply chain pressures accelerated to reach a new peak by the end of 2021. Our new #WEO research looks at improving the resilience of trade and global value chains. https://t.co/soJF7J6Ncz https://t.co/XgIkhK7Rrl

Uncertainty from the war in Ukraine is rising, a bad sign for economic output. See #IMFBlog for more on our research, which shows this could reduce full-year global growth by up to 0.35 percentage point. https://t.co/KIlREkOLhC https://t.co/HBJhGthsHF

How will cross-border use of #DigitalMoney affect the international monetary system? Join us on April 18 at 2:30 PM ET, to discuss the roles the public and private sectors will have in the future of money. https://t.co/kowwpu9z52 #CBDC https://t.co/bhrFh5POPR

The war in Ukraine comes when the global economy is recovering from the pandemic. Save the date and join us for our debate with policymakers on the global economic outlook and other pressing topics.

Visit the 2022 IMF Spring Meetings’ Virtual NewsStand to check out the Meetings’ media partners and get their latest coverage on the global economy and international development. https://t.co/59cXjQT03q https://t.co/pUj2aOvR8z

War in Ukraine has boosted the World Uncertainty Index, which tracks economic unknowns across 143 countries. That’s not an auspicious sign for global growth, as we highlight in the latest #IMFBlog. https://t.co/KIlREkOLhC https://t.co/BLAjayC82H
Access to education is key to advancing the health and well-being of women and children. How many girls around the world are currently not attending school? #IMFinspired

During her 2022 Spring #IMFmeetings curtain raiser speech, IMF head @KGeorgieva warned that inflation could remain elevated and harder to control. https://t.co/TaB0yR7kqu #IMFMeetings https://t.co/8zVUUqJHVO

The increase in inflation in Latin America was initially driven by surging food and energy prices but is now broader, in part because of a strong recovery in demand.

To find out more, read our latest #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/eGmBZznJpM #IMFAmericas https://t.co/eiidpCF7fc

What is the future of #DigitalMoney? Join @KGeorgieva and global policymakers on April 18, at 2:30 PM ET, to discuss the roles the public and private sectors will have in digital money. https://t.co/kowwpu9z52 #CBDC https://t.co/SiDrbqlCuK

As  governments deploy  the use of technology to accelerate recovery from the pandemic, how can they use policies to bridge the digital divide? 

Join our GovTech sessions (starting at 9am EST) at the #IMFMeetings to learn about these issues and more:  https://t.co/WTqNM1EfUv https://t.co/VZG3eScdaq

2022 will be a crucial year for implementing the two-pillar plan to reform international tax rules and ensure that big corporations pay their fair share. Learn more at #IMFblog

https://t.co/qUFlQj9EUc https://t.co/phrDfQ1Z9c

We are faced with the most complex policy environment of our lifetime. Immediate priorities:
1⃣ End the war in Ukraine
2⃣ Confront the pandemic
3⃣ Tackle inflation and debt

IMF Chief @KGeorieva during her 2022 Spring #IMFmeetings curtain raiser speech. https://t.co/TaB0yRptEC https://t.co/BfYL1CAvg2

Our #WEO analysis of advanced economies finds that the average green-intensive job earns about 7% more than the average pollution-intensive job. Our latest #IMFBlog shows how the right policies can help shift the balance toward greener jobs. https://t.co/P6CX1iNtjf https://t.co/3m7m6yb5QL

IMF Chief @KGeorgieva’s call to action: bolster food security w/ a multilateral initiative—to prevent more hunger, more poverty, & more social unrest, especially for countries that have struggled to escape fragility & conflict for many years. https://t.co/TaB0yRoVP4 #IMFMeetings https://t.co/7iUImAJGr9

Countries need to invest now to fight & adapt to #climatechange. The IMF’s new Resilience & Sustainability Trust can help. 

Join @KGeorgieva & Tuvalu 🇹🇻 Foreign Minister Simon Kofe April 15 at 7:30 AM ET as they discuss what leaders need to do now.   

💻 https://t.co/XTdAc2vng8 https://t.co/PengIKhE0n

IMF Chief @Kgeorgieva speaks on the economic challenges we face. 

2022 Spring #IMFMeetings Curtain Raiser speech: https://t.co/TaB0yRoVP4 #IMFMeetings https://t.co/swT3Xcn7mS

For most countries, growth will still remain in positive territory. But the war’s impact will contribute to forecast downgrades for 143 economies this year—accounting for 86 percent of global GDP, @Kgeorgieva said in her #IMFmeetings curtain raiser speech. https://t.co/TaB0yRoVP4 https://t.co/typl4rbrXp

“Facing Crisis Upon Crisis: How the World Can Respond”
2022 Spring Meetings Curtain Raiser speech by IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva.

Read the full speech here: https://t.co/TaB0yR7kqu #IMFMeetings https://t.co/TO50S2DZsY

For #Pakistan 🇵🇰 to survive climate change, it needs to protect its forests. But deforestation levels in the country have reached a record high. So, the #10BillionTreeTsunamiProgramme @Plant4Pak was born. Learn more: https://t.co/dEDRHdA6g3

What is the impact of digital payments on efficiency, innovation, the structure of banking, and financial inclusion in emerging economies?

Join the #IMFmeetings to discuss these issues, and more. Check out our FinTech lineup starting at 10:30 am EST.

https://t.co/WTqNM1EfUv https://t.co/rL27STCluU

ICYMI, we discussed new IMF research on the impact of the green economic transformation on jobs. https://t.co/PNkVHprMMG #greenjobs #WEO
🎙 @johnbluedorn
🎙 @njharbo
🎙 @CNBCJulianna

🎧 https://t.co/16vokIkLu3

We developed a policy package that would help reallocate workers to greener industries and keep employment steady, key to help incentivize action on the transition to a net-zero economy. https://t.co/PNkVHprMMG #WEO https://t.co/J4ikRuuUlE

A policy package including a green infrastructure investment push, carbon prices, income support for low-income workers, and training can move the economy toward net-zero emissions. More in our latest #WEO research. https://t.co/PNkVHprMMG #GreenJobs

Agreement between key emitting countries on a carbon price floor would be an important start to mitigate #ClimateChange. Watch the interview with the IMF’s James Roaf w/ @TIME ‘s @JustinWorland.  Learn more about design options in our #FiscalMonitor 
https://t.co/wu0aXs8Egx

More needs to be done for developing economies to reap the benefits from Intl. coordination over taxation of multinationals and individuals. Analysis and discussions in the new #FiscalMonitor. Watch the interview w/ the IMF’s Shafik Hebous and  @SurRuiz 
https://t.co/yLQqvTCiVZ

A policy package including a green infrastructure investment push, carbon prices, income support for low-income workers, and training can move the economy toward net-zero emissions. More in our latest #WEO research. https://t.co/UfOPDbgwpn #GreenJobs

The probability of people moving from pollution-intensive to greener jobs is between 4% and 7%. The right policies can help shift the balance toward greener jobs and ease the move for workers. More in our latest #IMFBlog. https://t.co/Kb6lUCjpAY #WEO https://t.co/oOpJPVx5W5

Investing now to prevent future crises. 

The new Resilience and Sustainability Trust will help vulnerable countries prepare for and fight climate change and future pandemics. 

Read the latest news: https://t.co/LH6ljInkt9 https://t.co/oTtwrkBqJV

Ever since mobile money was launched in Africa in 2007, it has revolutionized financial inclusion for people without bank accounts. But does mobile money count as money in the economy?

Join the #IMFMeetings Analytical Corner starting April 14, 1030am EST.
https://t.co/DYSA3HrhxD https://t.co/x11dQJUMSO

Hiring rates for #greenjobs held up better than for all jobs in the early months of the pandemic and rose steadily over 2021 with the strengthening global recovery. More in our latest #WEO report. https://t.co/UfOPDaYVxP #GreenJobs https://t.co/84EVmSdG5w

Our analysis of advanced economies finds that the average green-intensive job earns about 7% more than the average pollution-intensive job. Our latest #IMFBlog shows how the right policies can help shift the balance toward greener jobs. https://t.co/Kb6lUCjpAY #WEO https://t.co/Wrj499IIXj

🗳️ What are the biggest challenges #fintech poses for financial stability?

#GFSR 👉https://t.co/nVwzVATfTD

Fast-growing fintech is disrupting traditional financial services, pushing them to innovate to remain relevant. It also poses new challenges for regulators and supervisors, as we explore in the latest Global Financial Stability Report #GFSR 
👉 https://t.co/vvSp2Mhx2I https://t.co/oyWqhPlCDt

One risk of decentralized finance, a financial network with no central intermediary, is cyber-attacks. News of these incidents historically has spurred customers to withdraw funds. See our new #IMFBlog for more on risk in this rapidly growing industry. 
👉 https://t.co/vvSp2Mhx2I https://t.co/2TNN5uZdia

The combination of fintech’s fast growth and the importance of its services can create risks to the financial system. See our new #IMFBlog for more on these changes, based on the latest Global Financial Stability Report. #GFSR https://t.co/vvSp2M0u0I https://t.co/74pIKyq8OF

The lack of centralized entities governing decentralized finance challenges effective regulation and supervision. Regulation should focus on the elements of the crypto ecosystem that enable it, such as stablecoin issuers and centralized exchanges. #GFSR https://t.co/QROWm2yjVG https://t.co/0NTH8eEUbH

#Fintech firms take on risks that traditional banks may not. The U.S. mortgage market shows evidence of the competitive pressure from fintech on the income of traditional lenders. https://t.co/QROWm2yjVG https://t.co/oWKTbLZbyF

#Fintech is increasingly disrupting core financial services traditionally provided by banks. Their fast growth & higher risk-taking, combined with less stringent regulation creates systemic risk and potential financial stability implications. #GFSR 👉 https://t.co/QROWm2yjVG https://t.co/SllzilguK1

Supply chain pressures accelerated to reach a new peak by the end of 2021. Our new #WEO research looks at improving the resilience of trade and global value chains. https://t.co/2HS24uk9nT https://t.co/mnKfAKi74N

TOMORROW, at 9:30 AM ET, join us and @GtownLawIIEL to launch Chapter 3 of the IMF’s Global Financial Stability Report on the implications for financial stability from the rapid growth of fintech 
👉 https://t.co/SUpYMWVrem #Fintech #GFSR https://t.co/nVigbKCklw

US, China, India, and EU are responsible for almost 2/3 of global emissions. If these countries agreed on an international carbon price floor, it could jumpstart climate action. See #IMFBlog
https://t.co/qUFlQj9EUc https://t.co/f4DNHKIumV

With the increasing use of digital currencies and payment systems, what policies can governments implement to create financial inclusion for all? 

Join the #IMFmeetings to learn more. Check out our New Economy Forum lineup starting Thursday at 11am EST. https://t.co/GmyfVCqfZ4 https://t.co/tNwoXpgF0L

What are the implications for financial stability from the rapid growth of fintech? 
👉Join us and @GtownLawIIEL on Apr. 13, at 9:30 AM ET, to discuss this and the launch of Chapter 3 of IMF’s Global Financial Stability Report. https://t.co/SUpYMWVrem #Fintech #GFSR https://t.co/mCvcLMLqg7

There’s growing risk that higher levels of debt may make it costlier for some countries to borrow. See our new #IMFBlog for more on how policies can help ease growing debt risks. https://t.co/HV6xDBjCo9 https://t.co/qrHaN16wuV

More diversification in a country’s trade, not less, improves resilience of the economy. Read our latest #IMFBlog to find out how greater diversification & greater substitutability within global value chains can help lessen the impact of future shocks https://t.co/HtUArzw5T1 #WEO
TOMORROW at 11 AM ET, join IMF’s @johnbluedorn and @njharbo’s conversation with @CNBCJulianna on policies to move workers to #greenjobs.  https://t.co/UfOPDaYVxP #WEO https://t.co/16vokIkLu3

Governments can help fill information gaps in supply chains, invest in trade and digital infrastructure, reduce trade costs, and minimize policy uncertainty. Our latest #WEO research offers advice on improving #globaltrade and value chains. https://t.co/2HS24uk9nT https://t.co/3eJ9dMXZ73

Lockdowns in countries that are trade partners accounted, on average, for up to 60% of the decline in imports in the first half of 2020. Read more on #IMFBlog about how global supply chains adjusted https://t.co/HtUArzw5T1 #WEO https://t.co/NYCrLqcR8Q

Policymakers will keep a focus on debt during the #IMFmeetings. Our new #IMFBlog shows why countries need a global cooperative approach to resolve debt problems and to prevent defaults. https://t.co/HV6xDBjCo9 https://t.co/Zl5pcdAPFQ

How should policymakers prepare for the next shocks as the pandemic affects trade and value chains? Join us for a conversation with IMF’s @ad1lmohommad and @politico’s @tradereporter on a new IMF research. https://t.co/UfOPDaYVxP #GlobalTrade https://t.co/RY29W8fxkh
